comments.body: Seems like a pretty good workflow. I'll try this and get back to you on whether it goes well :)

Yeah, we've currently created one site (the main one), one for me to dev on, and one for him to dev on. I'll sign and publish for now but sharing the private key is a good idea.

Thanks!
Thanks for the detailed answer and your catch-all one, will definitely be using across my zites!

Great answer, very in-depth. For now as we're just working on a small site I'll probably just share the private key, but the above solutions are great for both site owners and possible moderators down the line :)

questions.title: Have multiple people working on the same zite?
questions.body:
Signing wise. If I want to work on the same zite with one other person, but I also want them to be able to change stuff, how exactly would that work? We would both each have a different ZeroID.

Would it be as simple as adding another row to:

```
"signs": {
 "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx": "yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy"
}
```

in content.json?

Ideally all source code versioning would happen over Git. Thanks!

questions.title: How to ignore two folders through content.json
questions.body:
For instance I currently have the following in my `content.json`:

```
...
"ignore": "data/users/.*",
...
```

But I also want to ignore the `.git` directory that's currently in the root of the zite.

Do you just craft some special regex magic to ignore both paths, or can you put multiple strings?

questions.title: How to set a custom zite favicon?
questions.body:
I just noticed [Git Center](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t) now has its own favicon in the tab instead of the typical ZeroNet one! 

Anybody know how this was done?

questions.title: Is it recommended to use BigFiles for small ~3-5MB files?
questions.body:
I have an idea for a zite that allows users to upload files typically in the ~3-5MB range, but could essentially range up to ~100MB. Obviously users would want to use the BigFiles feature to download these larger files.

Is there any known downside to using BigFiles for smaller sized files? Any unnecessary overheads?

answers.body:
Think I'll just make all files optional and refer to them all as BigFile. Pretty sure it'll just download it from one peer like a normal file if it's too small :)

Thanks naeui7tycw9p35y9@zeroid.bit!
